Package com.bluegosling.concurrent

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Awaitable
    An object that represents a future event.
    Cancellable
    Represents an activity that can be cancelled.
    ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Like a Supplier, except allowed to throw an InterruptedException.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Similar to ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier, but accepts a time limit argument and can throw a TimeoutException if the given time limit elapses before the result value is available.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleWait
    A function that waits up to a given limit for some event.
    Scheduled
    A specialization of Delayed that allows for more accurate comparisons between the time at which instances are scheduled.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractQueuedReferenceSynchronizer<S,R>
    Provides a framework for implementing blocking locks and related synchronizer that rely on FIFO wait queues.
    Duration
    Represents a duration of time that is backed by an integral length and a unit.
    ManagedBlockers
    Numerous utility methods related to blocking using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers.
    RateLimitedBlockingQueue<E>  
    RateLimiter
    A synchronizer that can be used to limit the rate, or frequency, of an operation.
    SameThreadExecutor
    A simple executor that runs each task synchronously in the same thread that submits it.
    ThreadFactories
    Utility methods for creating thread factories.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DeadlockException
    An unchecked exception that is thrown when a lock acquisition is attempted that would result in deadlock.
    ReentranceException
    An exception indicating that a reentrant lock acquisition was attempted but is not unsupported.

Package com.bluegosling.concurrent Description

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package. The various sub-packages provide numerous additions while the classes in this package are various new interfaces and utility types.
